text: these are Canada's oil fields walls of
flames that have swept across this huge
area all week are still raging and
destroying everything in their path the
town of Fort McMurray in Alberta is in
what's known as Canada's oil sands tens
of thousands of people have already been
evacuated and are heading south to the
relative safety of Edmonton people have
had little or no time to collect their
belongings one family could only watch
fire engulfed their home through CCTV
cameras the aftermath has left half the
town completely destroyed elsewhere the
flames continue to sweep across this dry
countryside the fire has engulfed around
400 square miles 1,600 homes and
buildings have been destroyed and there
are fears that oil storage facilities
could explode with the about a 14
kilometre blast radius so I mean it's a
pretty substantial area convoys of
vehicles are moving south but at times
this has even become too dangerous as
flames 200 feet high reached close to
the only main road those who have
reached safety are staying in shelters
five hours south the drive that has
taken some 16 hours
officials say the Wildfire could double
in size over the weekend the hope is a
chance of rain tomorrow but it's only a
chance
Keith Doyle BBC news
